intro: Baccharis rupicola subsp. summapacis, commonly known as the rock baccharis, is a shrub native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant is adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in coastal areas and dry hillsides. It has a woody stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in harsh, low-nutrient soils.
